Name: MCAT Physics and Math Review (Graduate School Test Preparation)

ReviewList.Text: This was a great book for reviewing physics material relevant to the MCAT. The practice questions and passages were quite helpful and explanations of solutions were insightful and easy to understand.  I highly recommend this book for someone that needs a concise yet comprehensive refresher.

Okay, so I thoroughly read multiple reviews on many prep materials. I have Exam Krackers and Berkley. For those who already have a good grasp on physics, EK is great. But for those who don't, like myself, Princeton is amazing. I got super frustrated at EK and TPR breaks it down much much better.
As someone who has read the Examkrackers and Kaplan, I feel these books go through all the topics in a very detailed way. At least this is the way I like to study.

This book has some typos. Ex: p218 it says k0 = 9 x 10^9 N m^2/C^2: ^2. Ex2: p289 bottom of the page there is an incorrect explanation. If you solve the units properly, you should get (kg x m^2)/(C x s) is not equal to [s]. The book's solution incorrectly put (kg x m^2)/(C^2 x s) is not equal to [s]. I have not recorded every typo I have come across but TPR's Gchem book, hyperlearning science workbook, bio book, and physics books have some notable typos. Not sure about their ochem book or verbal reasoning book. Havent been able to find any in those yet. They are good study books. But these typos are frustrating to me. I wish there was a forum or something about TPR typos so I can find and correct them all.
This book was an excellent reference tool for concepts I didn't understand and covered plenty of MCAT examples. I'd say this book is the most useful out of the princeton review MCAT subject series.
I am really enjoying studying from this book, having already taken Physics in college this book is great for helping me brush-up on concepts and equations I have forgotten.
This is a great product. It really prepares for the physics portion of the MCAT.  It is also a good review for intro to physics classes if one want to freshen up on there math
This book was filled with highlighter, pen and answers. When I reviewed the condition of this book online, it was in "good" condition without much marking. This was false.
The content of the book is useful for MCAT and the delivery time was acceptable. However, the book came in poor conditions, with the back cover being slightly torn.

The book is well organized with all the Physics topics topics you need to know for the MCAT. Please note these books are for reviewing purposes and should complement your textbook along with working as much practice problems as possible if full mastery of the material is desired (beyond your high MCAT score aspirations). Study hard and all the best.
